pwm_example.c File Reference

Detailed Description

PWM example driver for AVR32 UC3.

This file provides an example for the PWM on AVR32 UC3 devices.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices with a PWM module can be used.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file pwm_example.c.

#include <avr32/io.h>
#include "pwm.h"
#include "gpio.h"

00086 {
00087   pwm_opt_t pwm_opt;                // PWM option config.
00088   avr32_pwm_channel_t pwm_channel;  // One channel config.
00089   // The channel number and instance is used in several functions.
00090   // It's defined as local variable for ease-of-use.
00091   unsigned int channel_id;
00092 
00093   channel_id = 0;
00094   gpio_enable_module_pin(AVR32_PWM_PWM_0_PIN, AVR32_PWM_PWM_0_FUNCTION);
00095 
00096   // PWM controller configuration.
00097   pwm_opt.diva = AVR32_PWM_DIVA_CLK_OFF;
00098   pwm_opt.divb = AVR32_PWM_DIVB_CLK_OFF;
00099   pwm_opt.prea = AVR32_PWM_PREA_MCK;
00100   pwm_opt.preb = AVR32_PWM_PREB_MCK;
00101 
00102   pwm_init(&pwm_opt);
00103 
00104   pwm_channel.CMR.calg = PWM_MODE_LEFT_ALIGNED;       // Channel mode.
00105   pwm_channel.CMR.cpol = PWM_POLARITY_LOW;            // Channel polarity.
00106   pwm_channel.CMR.cpd = PWM_UPDATE_DUTY;              // Not used the first time.
00107   pwm_channel.CMR.cpre = AVR32_PWM_CPRE_MCK_DIV_256;  // Channel prescaler.
00108   pwm_channel.cdty = 5;   // Channel duty cycle, should be < CPRD.
00109   pwm_channel.cprd = 20;  // Channel period.
00110   pwm_channel.cupd = 0;   // Channel update is not used here.
00111   // With these settings, the output waveform period will be :
00112   // (115200/256)/20 == 22.5Hz == (MCK/prescaler)/period, with MCK == 115200Hz,
00113   // prescaler == 256, period == 20.
00114 
00115   pwm_channel_init(channel_id, &pwm_channel); // Set channel configuration to channel 0.
00116 
00117   pwm_start_channels(1 << channel_id);  // Start channel 0.
00118 
00119   while(1);
00120 
00121   // Stop channel output.
00122   pwm_stop_channels(1 << channel_id); // Stop channel 0.
00123 
00124   return 0;
00125 }
